page.title: 06SANDWITH VILLAGE
page.content: Sandwith village lies on the southern edge of Whitehaven and spreads along either side of the road.The village is made up mainly of farms and cottages,the oldest buildings being made of irregular sandstone blocks and having thick tiled roofs.Many old cottages have been renovated and the number of farms has decreased.The village has several new houses built to modern design ,the most recent being 4 detached houses just completed.There are two pubs,The Lowther Arms and the Dog and Partridge.There is also a Post Office on the site of a 'third' public house (The White Horse) which is now a private house. Dates were found on the old school (1834) and a large house(1661) but records suggest the village is much older.
